NewsBreak - European Markets Surge on Report of Hong Kong Climbdown

Stock Markets Sep 04, 2019 03:53AM ET

© Reuters. Investing.com -- Europe's stock markets surged in early trading and Hong Kong's rose by the most since 2011 after a report claiming that the head of Hong Kong's legislative assembly would formally a controversial bill which sparked three months of protests. The report comes barely a month before China is due to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the Communist Party's victory in China's civil war. Carrie Lam will withdraw a bill that would have allowed Hong Kong residents to be extradited to the Chinese mainland for trial, the South China Morning Post reported. opens up 0.9%, +1.1%, +1.0% China-focused banks HSBC (LON: ) +1.8%, Standard Chartered (LON: ) +2.7% Luxury groups surge: Richemont SA (SIX: ) +4.2%, Kering (PA: ) +3.8%, LVMH (PA: ) +3.4%, Burberry (LON: ) +2.9% U.S. futures rise: +0.9%, +0.8% +1.3%
